author: gurukamath
content: Yeah. This one just looks like its it needs a fix. `timestamp` to `Uint`. Was looking into the history of this. `timestamp` and `gas_limit` both started out having the same type. `timestamp` was changed to `U256` to for type compatibility in a commit like 4 years ago. I'll create an issue

author: _shemnon
content: I think you are remembering the push to make chainIds 64 bit, but there was pushback because it shut down using cryptographic hashes as chainIDs.

author: sky.cactus
content: Yes, ChainID was one of them (thanks for the reminder!) and I was convinced by your arguments that 256-bit was useful.  I think there were 2 others as well around the same time though, and I thought it was nonce and gas limit, but maybe timestamp?

author: _shemnon
content: Given that most sub-second chains have resolved to duplicate timestamps 64 bit would be fine.  It's only if we go to nanos (or micro or milli) that it would matter,
